CatDescriptText: Mr. Ernest Hester, porter, Hill District and Mr. Bryce Allen, new Army recruit, Whitaker, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 21, 1962, pg. 17 with question: "Do you approve of the United States testing nuclear weapons in the atmosphere?" Mr. Hester's answer reads: "No. The fallout is bad on the health."  Mr. Allen's answer reads: "No, I'm not an authority, but I know it is endangering the world.  They should ban the bomb, not meaning that the United States should get rid of it entirely, but that it shouldn't be tested and should be kept on the shelf to be used in an emergency."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ernest Hester wearing short sleeve button down collared shirt, standing in front of ribbed metal wall, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Bryce Allen wearing button down collared shirt with rolled short sleeves, standing in front of the Brass Rail restaurant, Smithfield Street, Downtown
